accessibilityInformation.description: Provide additional, specific documentation for participants about how disabilities are, or can be supported at the Event.

accessibilitySupport.description: Used to specify the types of disabilities or impairments that are supported at an event

activity.description: Specifies the physical activity or activities that will take place during an event

ageRange.description: Indicates that an event is suitable for a specific age range. If only a single age is specified then this is assumed to be a minimum age. Age ranges can be specified as follows: 18-30

attendeeInstructions.description: Provides additional notes and instructions for event attendees. E.g. more information on how to find the event, what to bring, etc.

category.description: Provides a set of tags that help categorise and describe an event, e.g. its intensity, purpose, etc.

description.example: An action packed, fast paced game that incorporates netball, handball and football.
description.description: A free text description of the event

duration.description: The duration of the event given in [ISO8601] format.

endDate.description:
The end date and time of the event. Can be specified as a schema:Date or  schema:DateTime
It is recommended that publishers provide either an  schema:endDate or a  schema:duration for an event.

eventStatus.description: The status of an event. Can be used to indicate rescheduled or cancelled events

genderRestriction.description: Indicates that an event is restricted to male, female or a mixed audience. If a gender restriction isn't specified then applications should assume that an event is suitable for a mixed audience

image.description: An image or photo that depicts the event, e.g. a photo taken at a previous event

isCoached.description: A boolean property that indicates whether an Event will be coached. This flag allows an Event to be marked as being coached without having to specify a named individual as a coach. This addresses both privacy concerns and also scenarios where the actual coach may only be decided on the day.

level.description: A general purpose property for specifying the suitability of an event for different participant “levels”. E.g. beginner/intermediate/advanced. Or in the case of martial arts, specific belt requirements. Values should ideally be drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

leader.description: Refers to a person (schema:Person) who will be leading an event. E.g. a coach. This is a more specific role than an organiser or a contributor

location.description:
The location at which the event will take place. Or, in the case of events that may span multiple locations, the initial meeting or starting point.
It is recommended that locations should be specified as a [Place](/models/place) complete with a fully described geographic location and/or address.
If only an address is available then this should be described as a [PostalAddress](/models/postaladdress).
Applications may use [schema:Text](http://schema.org/Text) to provide a more general description of a location ("In Victoria Park, near the lake"), but this is not recommended: consuming applications will be unable to help users discover opportunities based on their location.

address.streetAddress: Raynes Park High School, 46A West Barnes Lane

example.description: Raynes Park High School in London
example.name: Raynes Park High School

maximumAttendeeCapacity.description: The maximum capacity of the event

meetingPoint.description: Instructions for the attendees of an Event about where they should meet the organizer or leader at the start of the event. Some larger locations may have several possible meeting points, so this property provides additional more specific directions.

organizer.description: The person or organization ultimately responsible for an event. An organizer might be an  schema:Organization or a schema:Person.

programme.description: Indicates that an event will be organised according to a specific Programme

remainingAttendeeCapacity.description: The number of places that are still available for the event

schedule.description: A schedule defines a repeating time period used to describe a regularly occurring Event. **Note: this is a draft Schema.org property. See https://github.com/openactive/modelling-opportunity-data/issues/2 for discussion.

startDate.description:
The start date and time of the event. Can be specified as a schema:Date or  schema:DateTime.
While this property is marked as optional, a data publisher must provide either a schema:startDate or specify a oa:schedule for an event.

url.description: A URL to a web page (or section of a page) that describes the event

description: There will be a description for this model which we'll generate and put here.
